Darkgamer504, I'm sorry you feel our policies regarding mods and licensing are stupid, but unfortunately they are very necessary.

If the modder of an "abandoned" mod wished for people to be able to make derivative works from it they were/are free to use a license that permits it. If they license it in such a way that forbids it then we should honor those wishes. For that matter, sometimes a modder goes quiet for a long time and then returns to their project (a good recent example would be AIES). How would it be fair to have their projects taken from them when they explicitly said they didn't want that done?

Basically, it is neither fair nor right for us to appropriate the works of others just because they have stopped maintaining them. They don't belong to us, we must honor the terms under which they chose to share their work. To do otherwise would discourage modders from sharing their work in the first place, so we use licensing rules to foster an environment that makes modders happy to share.

This is ignoring the whole issue of legal liability in enabling copyright infringement by dishonoring license terms, which can get Squad and its community in a whole heap of trouble.
